div.head: Introduction
div.p: TEI Rails is a content management system, writting in Ruby on Rails, for documents encoded in TEI. Development funding for the project came from a grant from the National Endowment for the Humanities at the University at Buffalo. The content management system is intended to run the Litgloss archive, which is a collection of texts in a variety of languages featuring pedagogically-useful annotations.

div.head: Features
div.p: TEI Rails has a number of features which make storing and collaborating on documents encoded in TEI easier. These features include support for document versioning, media file storage with associated documents, a workflow which facilitates collaboration, and advanced features for document annotation.

div.head: Document Versioning
div.p: TEI Rails, by default, stores all versions created of a particular document. At any time, authorized users may view or revert to any one of the previous versions of a content item.

div.head: Document Workflow
div.p: The system also supports a hierarchy of users and workflow for collaboration. Without customization, the default hierarchy allows for classes of users considered to be system administrators, editors, contributors, and normal users.

TEI Rails allows for users to collaborate on documents by creating private "clones" of those documents. A clone is basically a shallow copy of a document into a private workspace of a user. Once a user and editor are satisfied with her changes, an editor may pull from these local changes and modify the public content item. This approach to document workflow, which allows for "clusters" of document clones around a central document object, allows for security while also providing a "sandbox" where users less familiar with TEI may try their changes safely.

div.head: Annotation
div.p: TEI Rails features a variety of different forms of "annotation". Since the native document format is TEI Lite (P5), annotations may be manually inserted into a document in a form following the TEI guidelines for version P5 and the TEI Lite DTD. In addition to this, TEI Rails includes a web-based editor allowing users without specific knowledge of XML or TEI to insert textual or graphical annotations of words or phrases in a document text.

TEI Rails also includes an Annotea server, which allows for collaboration on documents through XPointer references to any rendered document in the TEI Rails system. This Annotea server was written as a Ruby on Rails plugin, and is shipped by default with TEI Rails installations. It is also available by itself for simple inclusion in other Ruby on Rails applications.

div.head: Media Files
div.p: TEI Rails helps to associate media files with TEI documents. It allows for images and audio files to be associated with a TEI content item or with annotations made with the web-based annotation editor. Facilities are provided so that users may upload media files via web forms.

div.head: XML Validation
div.p: TEI Rails checks all input against a DTD for TEI Lite, and it passes errors from the validator to the user. No data are saved in the system if a document is not well-formed and able to be validated against a DTD.
